div.p: STIPA, Feather Grass, in botany : A genus of plants belonging to the claſs of triandria, and order of digynia ; and in the natural ſyſtem ranging under the 4th order, Gramina. The calyx is bivalved. The exterior valve of the corolla is terminated by an awn ; the baſe is jointed.

There are nine ſpecies, the pennata, juncea, capillata, ariſtella, tenaciſſima, avenacea, membranacea, arguens, and ſpicata. Of theſe one only is Britiſh, the pennata or common feather graſs. The beards are feathered. The plant riſes to the height of 10 inches, grows on mountains, and flowers in July or August.
